name: markdown is cool!
body:
> limitation: can't do lists within table cells


> for tables: Reference-style links use a second set of square brackets, inside which you place a label of your choosing to identify the link:

> This is [an example][table1] reference-style link.
You can optionally use a space to separate the sets of brackets

Then, anywhere in the document, you define your link label like this, on a line by itself

[table1]: http://example.com/#linktotable  "Table 1"

# Table 1 
supposing that your rendering engine turns headers into direct links with fragments (#fragment)


Some sample code that you might use `sandwiches = great` 

malicious domain: `evil.ru`

```
anything you want
some code
pants = great
```


> here's how to do tables

table header | other column
----- | ----
table cell | table cell
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
